intro: Hippocratea chesseana, commonly known as the Chessean hippocratea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces capsules as its fruit. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
